title: Understanding Protective Factors
text: Protective factors are conditions or attributes that help people deal more effectively with stressful events and mitigate or eliminate risk in families and communities.

title: Examples of Protective Factors
text: Consider factors that contribute to a person's well-being and resilience, such as social support, healthy lifestyle choices, and positive coping mechanisms.

hintAnswer: support received from family and friends, religious practices, being part of a social group, getting physical activity, eating healthy foods, and using positive coping skills
title: Identifying Protective Factors
text: Which of the following are considered protective factors?
choices: support received from family and friends
